text:
Hi Francois, thanks for raising this.

You can install `0.7.5`, which contains minor fixes to the UI and the auto top-up app.

The release notes should appear in the docs page shortly, but let me past them here below.

```This version includes fixes to the UI and the Top Up app. The DAR files are unchanged from the previous version.

UI:

- expose button to withdraw an ``Allocation``
- fix rendering of credential billings and commercial agreements in case of long-running queries

Top Up app:

- make it auth provider agnostic```

elements.text:
Hi Francois, thanks for raising this.

You can install

, which contains minor fixes to the UI and the auto top-up app.

The release notes should appear in the docs page shortly, but let me past them here below.

This version includes fixes to the UI and the Top Up app. The DAR files are unchanged from the previous version.

UI:

- expose button to withdraw an ``Allocation``
- fix rendering of credential billings and commercial agreements in case of long-running queries

Top Up app:

- make it auth provider agnostic

text:
It seems to be due to Utility app not being able to efficiently query ACS properly.

Can try to following:
• Prune participant node to free up space so that query load is lighter (solve the issue temporarily)
• Increase IOPS on the infrastructure side of things (resolves the issue more efficiently)
It doesn’t fully address the issue for us but it should still be somewhat functional (as compared to totally useable)

elements.text:

It doesn’t fully address the issue
for us
but it should still be somewhat functional (as compared to totally useable)

text:
btw, I'm reading through <https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_helm.html> and there it is written

```In the future, your OIDC provider might additionally be required to issue JWTs with a scope explicitly set to daml_ledger_api (when requested to do so as part of the OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow).```
How do you currently get around this when deploying your validator node?

elements.text: btw, I'm reading through
and there it is written

In the future, your OIDC provider might additionally be required to issue JWTs with a scope explicitly set to daml_ledger_api (when requested to do so as part of the OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow).
How do you currently get around this when deploying your validator node?

text: The JWT token is issued with that scope. "scp": "daml_ledger_api". However to the scope that EntraID expected in the authorization request need to be prepended with the resource identifier

elements.text: The JWT token is issued with that scope. "scp": "daml_ledger_api". However to the scope that EntraID expected in the authorization request need to be prepended with the resource identifier

text: understood, thank you

elements.text: understood, thank you
For a bit more context. On the wallet UI and CNS UI. There is a config value that is set to override the scope sent in the auth request.

window.splice_config = {
      auth: {
        algorithm: "rs-256",
        authority: "${SPLICE_APP_UI_AUTH_URL}",
        client_id: "${SPLICE_APP_UI_AUTH_CLIENT_ID}",
        token_audience: "${SPLICE_APP_UI_AUTH_AUDIENCE}",
        token_scope: "
Although at there is no ENV to set this. We were able to override the config using a configmap. But the code does handle custom scope it receives from the config.

text:
I just did a side-by-side diff of _your_ `nginx.conf` and `compose.yaml` and _mine_.

I assume you are running these on a workstation, is that correct? That’s what I am doing and I have the following:

```      - SPLICE_APP_UI_HTTP_URL=true```
You have `false`.

I vaguely recall there being something about that. It’s worth a try if you are running this on your workstation.

We’ve also found that behavior varies between Chrome, Firefox, and Safari, because of the `*.localhost` URL tld.

For grpcurl to work, I had to edit my `/etc/hosts` file:

```# Added by Wallace
# So that grpcurl would recognized the host name

127.0.0.1      participant.localhost```
Hopefully something here helps. :shrug::skin-tone-2:
